alert.note: Alert for Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 8:30PM EDT until May 08 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Estill. In southeast Kentucky, Breathitt, Lee, Magoffin, Morgan, Owsley and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Salyersville, Beattyville, Campton, Booneville, Mason, Simpson, Lewis, Fincastle, Bethany, Pence, Lane, Hollonville, War Creek, Mary, Lawson, Widecreek, Flat, Vortex and Fillmore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
